form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Cotton (for himself, Mrs. Britt, Mr. Scott of Florida, and Mr. Hawley) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

form.official-title: To require the Secretary of Health and Human Services to conduct a study on the impacts of arsenic, cadmium, mercury, and lead in infant formula on infant health and establish standards for regulating the content of such substances in infant formula.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Safe Baby Formula Act of 2025.

Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Health and Human Services shall complete a study on the impacts of arsenic, cadmium, mercury, and lead in infant formula on infant health.

section.header: Prohibition of toxic metals in infant formula

section.text: In this Act, the term infant formula has the meaning given such term in section 201(z) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 321(z)).
